Journal.Title: Huan jing ke xue= Huanjing kexue

Article.ArticleTitle: [Influence of Chemical Pre-oxidation on Chloral Hydrate Formation of Threonine].

AbstractText: The influences of different chemical pre-oxidants, including sodium hypochlorite (NaClO), chlorine dioxide (ClO<sub>2</sub>), permanganate (KMnO<sub>4</sub>), hydrogen peroxide (H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>), ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) and ozone/hydrogen peroxide (O<sub>3</sub>/H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>), on chloral hydrate (CH) formation were studied for threonine that has the highest special chloral hydrate formation potential (SCHFP). Suitable pre-oxidants and corresponding optimal doses were determined to provide guidance for controlling chloral hydrate (CH) formation during drinking water treatment. The results indicated that the pre-oxidants that could decrease CH formation for one day incubation time (CH<sub>1d</sub>) were H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>, ClO<sub>2</sub>, KMnO<sub>4</sub> and NaClO, and the corresponding suitable doses were 3, 0.5, 0.6 and 0.5 mg·L<sup>-1</sup>, and the corresponding CH<sub>1d</sub> removal rates were 61.54%, 47.63%, 29.77% and 10.94%, respectively. The pre-oxidants that could decrease CH formation potential (CHFP) were KMnO<sub>4</sub>, NaClO, H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> and ClO<sub>2</sub>, and the corresponding suitable doses were 0.6 mg·L<sup>-1</sup>, 0.5 mg·L<sup>-1</sup>, 3 mg·L<sup>-1</sup> and 0.5 mg·L<sup>-1</sup>, and the corresponding CHFP removal rates were 41.01%, 33.38%, 8.36% and 2.40%, respectively. In addition, O<sub>3</sub> and O<sub>3</sub>/H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> were not suitable for controlling CH in the conventional treatment process because they could increase CH<sub>1d</sub> and CHFP.
